original_title: How Many Western ICs Are There In Russia’s Weapons?
original_content:
Recently, the Ukrainian government has published a database of Western components being used in recently produced Russian armaments, and its a fascinating scroll. Just how much does Russia rely on Western manufacturers parts? It turns out, a surprising amount. For instance, if you are wondering which ICs are used to build Iran-produced Shahed drones, it seems that its a whole bunch of Texas Instruments parts, as well as some Maxim, Intel, and Xilinx ones. Many of the parts in the lists are MCUs and FPGAs, but its also surprising how many of the components are jelly bean parts with multiple suppliers.
There appear to be thousands of parts listings, compiled from a good few dozen pieces of equipment that volunteers appear to have taken apart and scrupulously documented  just take a look at the dropdowns at the top of the page. The Ukrainian government is advocating for parts restrictions to be implemented based upon this data  as we all remember, its way harder to produce hardware when you cant buy crucial ICs.
Even for a regular hacker, this database is worth a scroll, if only to marvel at all the regular parts we wouldnt quite associate with military use. Now, all thats left is to see whether any of the specific chips pictured have been sold to washing machine manufacturers.
title: ロシアの武器に使用されている部品：ウクライナ政府のデータベース
body: ウクライナ政府が最近、ロシアの軍需品に使われている西側のコンポーネントのデータベースを公開し、これは興味深い情報源だ。ロシアが西側メーカーの部品にどれほど依存しているか、実は驚くほどだ。多くの部品がTexas Instruments、Maxim、Intel、Xilinxなどの部品で構成されている。
titles: ロシアの武器に使用されている部品：ウクライナ政府のデータベース
ウクライナ政府が公開したロシアの軍事装備に使用されているウェスタンコンポーネント
イラン製ドローンに使用されている部品データベース公開
ロシアの武器にはTexas Instrumentsなどの部品が多数使用
部品リストの数千の項目：ウクライナ政府が提唱した部品制限の必要性
